phrases.usage: Use this phrase to tell the repair person about physical damage.
phrases.example: I am very sad because my screen is broken now.

phrases.usage: Say this to describe a display that shows no light.
phrases.example: I press the power button but it is black.

phrases.usage: Use this when the device does not respond to power.
phrases.example: My phone is cold and it is not turning on.

phrases.usage: Tell the staff about the power status of your device.
phrases.example: I need a charger because the battery is low.

phrases.usage: Ask this to find out if the repair is fast.
phrases.example: This phone is important so can you fix it today?

phrases.usage: The repair staff says this to explain the waiting time.
phrases.example: The repair is difficult so it will take two days.

phrases.usage: The staff says this when they need your device overnight.
phrases.example: You can go home now but please leave it here.

phrases.text: So it will be ready on {day}, right?
phrases.usage: Use this to confirm the day you can pick it up.
phrases.example: So it will be ready on Friday afternoon, right?

keyVocabulary.definition: The glass part of a phone that shows images.
Something that is damaged and does not work well.
The part inside a device that gives it power.
To fix something that is old or not working.
When something is finished and you can take it.
